title: NYPD may have UnitedHealthcare CEO's killer's name but 'we don't want to release...'
content: The NYPD is closing in on Brian Thompson's killer, Mayor Eric Adams confirmed. While the police may have identified the suspect, Adams stated they won't release the name yet to avoid tipping him off. He emphasized the meticulous investigation, assuring the public that the net is tightening and justice will be served.
summary: The NYPD is closing in on Brian Thompson's killer, Mayor Eric Adams confirmed.  While the police may have identified the suspect, Adams stated they won't release the name yet to avoid tipping him off.  He emphasized the meticulous investigation, assuring the public that the net is tightening and justice will be served.

title: 'Trump is back to dominate...': MAGA gives verdict after Donald's viral handshake with Macron
content: Donald Trump's handshake with French President Emmanuel Macron during his visit to Paris for the Norte Dame reopening became a viral moment they were seen caught in a moment of wrestling as to who would dominate whom. Donald Trump kept his hand in such a position that it became a vertical handshake and MAGA supporters cheered that Trump is back to dominate and rule.
summary: Donald Trump's handshake with French President Emmanuel Macron during his visit to Paris for the Norte Dame reopening became a viral moment they were seen caught in a moment of wrestling as to who would dominate whom. Donald Trump kept his hand in such a position that it became a vertical handshake and MAGA supporters cheered that Trump is back to dominate and rule.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy has a message to GOP Senators who don't want to confirm Trump's picks
content: "President Trump won by a massive margin with a historic mandate & he deserved the Cabinet he desires to govern," Ramaswamy issued a sweeping statement amid row over Pete Hegseth clouding his senate confirmation. Apart from Hegseth, Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard too may face challenges in Senate confirmation, according to reports.
summary: "President Trump won by a massive margin with a historic mandate & he deserved the Cabinet he desires to govern," Ramaswamy issued a sweeping statement amid row over Pete Hegseth clouding his senate confirmation. Apart from Hegseth, Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard too may face challenges in Senate confirmation, according to reports.

title: France's iconic Notre Dame Cathedral rises from ashes, to reopen 5 years after fire
Did UnitedHealthcare post a job ad for CEO soon after Brian Thompson's murder? Here's the truth
content: A fake job posting for UnitedHealthcare CEO went viral after Brian Thompson's murder, falsely suggesting the company was quickly seeking a replacement. UnitedHealthcare received a lot of flak as many social media users celebrated Brian Thompson's murder accusing his company of denying health insurance payout and thereby killing thousands every year.
summary: A fake job posting for UnitedHealthcare CEO went viral after Brian Thompson's murder, falsely suggesting the company was quickly seeking a replacement. UnitedHealthcare received a lot of flak as many social media users celebrated Brian Thompson's murder accusing his company of denying health insurance payout and thereby killing thousands every year.

title: One of Diddy's accusers reveals identity as ex-wife of this NHL star
content: Anna Kane, ex-wife of NHL player Evander Kane, publicly identified herself as one of the women accusing Sean "Diddy" Combs of rape and sexual assault. Kane alleges that when she was 17, she was drugged and gang-raped by Diddy, his friend Harve Pierre, and an unidentified man. She first used a pseudonym but now revealed her name as she said she is not intimidated to reveal her identity.
summary: Anna Kane, ex-wife of NHL player Evander Kane, publicly identified herself as one of the women accusing Sean "Diddy" Combs of rape and sexual assault. Kane alleges that when she was 17, she was drugged and gang-raped by Diddy, his friend Harve Pierre, and an unidentified man. She first used a pseudonym but now revealed her name as she said she is not intimidated to reveal her identity.

title: Notre Dame to reopen five years after blaze; Trump, Zelenskyy, global leaders to attend grand ceremony
Did Brian Thompson killer carry 'Peak Design' backpack? Company CEO says...
content: Peak Design's CEO, Paul Dering, said the backpack that the shooter of Brian Thompson was carrying might be an older model of their Everyday Backpack. A backpack has been found in Central Park and sent for forensic testing. It could be the bag the killer was seen carrying in the surveillance footage. He might have discarded it as he fled on a bike from the murder spot. Investigators believe the killer has fled out of NYC.
summary: Peak Design's CEO, Paul Dering, said the backpack that the shooter of Brian Thompson was carrying might be an older model of their Everyday Backpack.  A backpack has been found in Central Park and sent for forensic testing. It could be the bag the killer was seen carrying in the surveillance footage. He might have discarded it as he fled on a bike from the murder spot. Investigators believe the killer has fled out of NYC.

title: UnitedHealth Group CEO reacts to 'celebration' after Brian Thompson killing: 'Highly disrespectful'
content: The CEO of UnitedHealth Group, the mother company of UnitedHealthcare, Andrew Witty condemned the inappropriate comments being said on social media following the murder of Brian Thompson. Witty urged employees to avoid engaging with the media. ​"I'd like to give you little bit of advice around the media…My strong advice and request to everybody is just don't engage with the media. If you're approached, I would recommend not responding and, if necessary, simply refer them to our own media organization.”
summary: The CEO of UnitedHealth Group, the mother company of UnitedHealthcare, Andrew Witty condemned the inappropriate comments being said on social media following the murder of Brian Thompson.   Witty urged employees to avoid engaging with the media. ​"I'd like to give you little bit of advice around the media…My strong advice and request to everybody is just don't engage with the media. If you're approached, I would recommend not responding and, if necessary, simply refer them to our own media organization.”

title: 'Let it play out': Trump says US should not get involved in Syria as rebels close in on Damascus
content: US President-elect Donald Trump urged the US to avoid involvement in the escalating Syrian conflict, where rebels are challenging President Assad's government. Trump believes Russia's potential exit from Syria could be beneficial. Meanwhile, Syrian rebels have launched a major offensive, encircling Damascus, prompting border closures by Lebanon and Jordan.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump urged the US to avoid involvement in the escalating Syrian conflict, where rebels are challenging President Assad's government. Trump believes Russia's potential exit from Syria could be beneficial. Meanwhile, Syrian rebels have launched a major offensive, encircling Damascus, prompting border closures by Lebanon and Jordan.

title: 'Goal is to overthrow Assad regime,' says HTS as rebels advance offensive in Syria
content: Islamist rebels are advancing on Damascus, claiming to have begun encircling the Syrian capital. Government forces deny retreating, but rebels have seized Daraa, "the cradle of the revolution." Homs is also under threat, prompting Hezbollah to send reinforcements. The rebel alliance, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), aims to overthrow Assad's government.
summary: Islamist rebels are advancing on Damascus, claiming to have begun encircling the Syrian capital.  Government forces deny retreating, but rebels have seized Daraa, "the cradle of the revolution."  Homs is also under threat, prompting Hezbollah to send reinforcements.  The rebel alliance, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), aims to overthrow Assad's government.

title: Netherlands: 2 dead, several injured in The Hague apartment blast; police hunt fleeing car - what we know so far
content: An explosion rocked a three-story apartment building in The Hague, Netherlands, early Saturday, injuring at least four and causing partial collapse. Rescue teams are searching for survivors amidst the debris, while police seek a car seen fleeing the scene. The Dutch royal family and national leaders expressed condolences and support.
summary: An explosion rocked a three-story apartment building in The Hague, Netherlands, early Saturday, injuring at least four and causing partial collapse.  Rescue teams are searching for survivors amidst the debris, while police seek a car seen fleeing the scene. The Dutch royal family and national leaders expressed condolences and support.

title: Day 4 and no arrest: Why has it turned tough for New York police to find UnitedHealthcare CEO killer
content: A CEO was killed outside a New York hotel. The killer escaped. Police are examining surveillance footage. The suspect was in the city for 10 days before the murder. He wore a hood and mask. DNA evidence has been recovered. Police face challenges in identifying the suspect.
summary: A CEO was killed outside a New York hotel. The killer escaped. Police are examining surveillance footage. The suspect was in the city for 10 days before the murder. He wore a hood and mask.  DNA evidence has been recovered.  Police face challenges in identifying the suspect.

title: Watch: Rebels bring down statue of Assad’s father in rebel-controlled Hama
content: Syrian rebels seized Hama, toppling a statue of Hafez al-Assad after government forces retreated. The victory follows similar rebel advances in Aleppo and other key cities, bringing them closer to Damascus. HTS declared victory in Hama, freeing prisoners. The rebels now threaten Homs, a strategically vital city for the regime, while international concern mounts.
summary: Syrian rebels seized Hama, toppling a statue of Hafez al-Assad after government forces retreated.  The victory follows similar rebel advances in Aleppo and other key cities, bringing them closer to Damascus.  HTS declared victory in Hama, freeing prisoners.  The rebels now threaten Homs, a strategically vital city for the regime, while international concern mounts.

title: What helped South Korean President survive impeachment after martial law controversy
6 Pakistani soldiers killed in militant attack in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: Militants attacked a security checkpoint in Kurram district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, killing six Pakistani security personnel and wounding seven. This incident follows recent sectarian clashes in the region, though it is reportedly unrelated. Separately, last month, Balochistan separatists attacked a border post, killing seven soldiers, highlighting ongoing security challenges in Pakistan.
summary: Militants attacked a security checkpoint in Kurram district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, killing six Pakistani security personnel and wounding seven. This incident follows recent sectarian clashes in the region, though it is reportedly unrelated.  Separately, last month, Balochistan separatists attacked a border post, killing seven soldiers, highlighting ongoing security challenges in Pakistan.

title: RFK Jr's bizarre questionnaire for hiring people: Sexual experience, sixth sense
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., poised to become Donald Trump's health secretary pending Senate confirmation, has a weird 90-minute questionnaire for people who want to work with him. The applicants will have to select pre-written responses about sexual experience, clairvoyance etc. The questionnaire should be filled only when the applicants are well-rested, well-fed and won't be disturbed for 90 minutes, it stipulated.
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., poised to become Donald Trump's health secretary pending Senate confirmation, has a weird 90-minute questionnaire for people who want to work with him. The applicants will have to select pre-written responses about sexual experience, clairvoyance etc. The questionnaire should be filled only when the applicants are well-rested, well-fed and won't be disturbed for 90 minutes, it stipulated.

title: Why this UCLA student is suing two California docs for giving her a double mastectomy at 14
content: A 20-year-old Californian, Kaya Clementine Breen, is suing two doctors and a hospital, alleging they prematurely transitioned her gender as a minor. Breen claims she received inadequate information about risks and irreversible procedures. This coincides with a Supreme Court case challenging Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors, highlighting the national debate surrounding this issue.
summary: A 20-year-old Californian, Kaya Clementine Breen, is suing two doctors and a hospital, alleging they prematurely transitioned her gender as a minor.  Breen claims she received inadequate information about risks and irreversible procedures.  This coincides with a Supreme Court case challenging Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors, highlighting the national debate surrounding this issue.

title: Donald Trump releases 'Fight, Fight, Fight' perfumes and colognes
content: Donald Trump launched new perfume and cologne lines, "Fight Fight Fight" and "Victory," priced from $199 to $298. He promoted them on Truth Social as representing winning. This follows his recent luxury watch release and existing product lines like the "God Bless the USA" Bible and "Never-Surrender" sneakers.
summary: Donald Trump launched new perfume and cologne lines, "Fight Fight Fight" and "Victory," priced from $199 to $298.  He promoted them on Truth Social as representing winning. This follows his recent luxury watch release and existing product lines like the "God Bless the USA" Bible and "Never-Surrender" sneakers.

title: 'You said this would not happen and it did': Karine Jean-Pierre slammed in press briefing over Hunter Biden's pardon
content: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre faced intense questioning over President Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter. Jean-Pierre's previous denials of such a possibility were highlighted, and her cited poll data was challenged for accuracy. The pardon followed Hunter Biden's guilty pleas and convictions on tax and gun charges, sparking controversy and social media backlash.
summary: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre faced intense questioning over President Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter.  Jean-Pierre's previous denials of such a possibility were highlighted, and her cited poll data was challenged for accuracy.  The pardon followed Hunter Biden's guilty pleas and convictions on tax and gun charges, sparking controversy and social media backlash.
